place_of_publication.publication_title: J. Proc. Linn. Soc., Bot., suppl.

treatment.description: Leaves broadly ovate, margins plane. Specialized asexual repro-duction by massive, brown, elliptic to spheric, many-celled gemmae occurring singly or very few together in distal leaf axils, of up to 50 cells, 95–300 µm.
treatment.discussion: Variety gregaria is known in the flora area from only two, nonfruiting collections (see R. H. Zander 1979). The costa in the Alberta collection ends before the rounded apex; Mexican specimens generally have, however, apiculate leaves like those of the typical variety.
